title: Upcycling of polyamides through chemical hydrolysis and engineered Pseudomonas putida.
authors: de Witt J, Luthe T, Wiechert J, Jensen K, Polen T, Wirtz A, Thies S, Frunzke J, Wynands B, Wierckx N
abstract: Aliphatic polyamides, or nylons, are widely used in the textile and automotive industry due to their high durability and tensile strength, but recycling rates are below 5%. Chemical recycling of polyamides is possible but typically yields mixtures of monomers and oligomers which hinders downstream purification.
